Line 23: Line 23:
==Character creation and casting==
==Character creation and casting==
â
In January 2009, it was announced that [[Anita Turner]] had stepped down from the position of series producer and that Gavin Blyth had taken over the role.<ref>{{citenews|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/news/a142807/richardson-turner-leave-emmerdale.html|title=Richardson, Turner leave 'Emmerdale'|work=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=15 January 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]}}</ref> With Turner's departure Blyth began the shows rejuvenation period. In May 2009, it was announced that series producer Gavin Blyth would introduce a "sexy" new farming family as part of the show's ongoing rejuvenation. The family were given the surname Barton and were described as a five-piece traditional, nuclear family and the new farming dynasty.<ref name="farming">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/news/a156759/emmerdale-casts-sexy-farming-family.html|title='Emmerdale' casts 'sexy' farming family|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|author=Green, Kris|date=22 May 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010}}</ref> The producers gave the family [[List of residences in Emmerdale#Butler's Farm|Butler's Farm]], taking over from the established [[Sugden family|Sugden]] family. Speaking of the family in an interview with entertainment website ''[[Digital Spy]]'', Gavin Blyth stated, "The Bartons are sexy, modern and contemporary. They're almost happy - and in soapland that's quite strange!"<ref>{{citenews|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/interviews/a159417/gavin-blyth-series-producer-emmerdale.html|title=Gavin Blyth (Series Producer, 'Emmerdale')|date=12 June 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010|first=Kris|last=Green|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]}}</ref>
+
In January 2009, it was announced that [[Anita Turner]] had stepped down from the position of series producer and that Gavin Blyth had taken over the role.<ref>{{citenews|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/news/a142807/richardson-turner-leave-emmerdale.html|title=Richardson, Turner leave 'Emmerdale'|work=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Kris|last=Green|date=15 January 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]}}</ref> With Turner's departure Blyth began the shows rejuvenation period. In May 2009, it was announced that series producer Gavin Blyth would introduce a "sexy" new farming family as part of the show's ongoing rejuvenation. The family were given the surname Barton and were described as a five-piece traditional, nuclear family and the new farming dynasty.<ref name="farming">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/news/a156759/emmerdale-casts-sexy-farming-family.html|title='Emmerdale' casts 'sexy' farming family|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|author=Green, Kris|date=22 May 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010}}</ref> The producers gave the family Butler's Farm, taking over from the established [[Sugden family|Sugden]] family. Speaking of the family in an interview with entertainment website ''[[Digital Spy]]'', Gavin Blyth stated, "The Bartons are sexy, modern and contemporary. They're almost happy - and in soapland that's quite strange!"<ref>{{citenews|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/interviews/a159417/gavin-blyth-series-producer-emmerdale.html|title=Gavin Blyth (Series Producer, 'Emmerdale')|date=12 June 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010|first=Kris|last=Green|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]}}</ref>
Former ''[[Britannia High]]'' actress Sophie Powles successfully auditioned for the role of Holly Barton in 2009 and joined the cast of ''Emmerdale'' as the eldest daughter of [[John Barton (Emmerdale)|John]] ([[James Thornton (actor)|James Thornton]]) and [[Moira Barton]] ([[Natalie J. Robb]]) and sister to [[Adam Barton|Adam]] ([[Adam Thomas]]) and [[Hannah Barton|Hannah]] ([[Grace Cassidy]]).<ref name="farming"/><ref>{{citenews|url=http://www.thisisgrimsby.co.uk/news/NEW-DARLING-DALES/article-1148180-detail/article.html|title=Actress lands Emmerdale role|date=9 July 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010|work=[[Grimsby Telegraph]]|publisher=This is Grimsby}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/scoop/a157728/first-picture-emmerdales-barton-family.html|title=First Picture: 'Emmerdale's Barton family|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|author=Green, Kris|date=1 June 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010}}</ref>
Former ''[[Britannia High]]'' actress Sophie Powles successfully auditioned for the role of Holly Barton in 2009 and joined the cast of ''Emmerdale'' as the eldest daughter of [[John Barton (Emmerdale)|John]] ([[James Thornton (actor)|James Thornton]]) and [[Moira Barton]] ([[Natalie J. Robb]]) and sister to [[Adam Barton|Adam]] ([[Adam Thomas]]) and [[Hannah Barton|Hannah]] ([[Grace Cassidy]]).<ref name="farming"/><ref>{{citenews|url=http://www.thisisgrimsby.co.uk/news/NEW-DARLING-DALES/article-1148180-detail/article.html|title=Actress lands Emmerdale role|date=9 July 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010|work=[[Grimsby Telegraph]]|publisher=This is Grimsby}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/scoop/a157728/first-picture-emmerdales-barton-family.html|title=First Picture: 'Emmerdale's Barton family|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|author=Green, Kris|date=1 June 2009|accessdate=13 August 2010}}</ref>
